    • Method Detail

      • freezeAccount

        public static boolean freezeAccount(Account account)

        The account that is on the source shard that is going to be transferred to target shard needs to be frozen.
        This account and all related accounts will be frozen.
        • If account is null IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        • If the account is already frozen it will return true, and log that the account was already frozen.
        • Once all related accounts are found, if the number of accounts exceeds the amount returned by AccountTransferPlugin.maxAllowedNumberOfAccountsToBeFrozen(Account) an IllegalStateException will be thrown for having too many accounts.
        Parameters:
        account - to be frozen from the source shard
        Returns:
        true if account is frozen, false otherwise

      • unFreezeAccount

        public static boolean unFreezeAccount(Account account)

        The frozen account that is on the target shard now needs to be unfrozen so that the customer can now start working on this account.
        • If account is null IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        • If the account is not frozen an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown and the account will not be unfrozen.
        Parameters:
        account - to be unfrozen from the target shard
        Returns:
        true if account is unfrozen, and false otherwise

      • purgeFrozenAccount

        public static boolean purgeFrozenAccount(Account account)

        The frozen account on the source shard needs to be purged, and this should be called to purge the frozen account.
        • If account is null an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        • If the account is not frozen an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown and the account will not be purged.
        Parameters:
        account - to be purged from the source shard
        Returns:
        true if account was purged, and false otherwise

      • findRelatedAccounts

        public static java.util.Set<Account> findRelatedAccounts(Account account)

        An account can be related to other accounts for example if accounts have been merged, or if policies have been moved from one account to another. This method finds all related accounts, and returns a set of related accounts and the original account.
        This will also call AccountTransferPlugin.additionalCustomerAccountRelationships(Account) to find any other relationships between accounts the customer has determined.
        If account is null IllegalArgumentException will be thrown

        Accounts are related if:
        • A policy has been moved from one account to another.
        • An account has been merged to another account.
        • A cancellation has been re-written to another account.
        • A policy has been split or spinned to another account.
        • Accounts have been linked together through the AccountAccount entity.
        Parameters:
        account - to find all related accounts
        Returns:
        a set of related accounts including the original account

      • findRelatedAccounts

        public static java.util.Set<Account> findRelatedAccounts(java.util.Set<Account> sourceAccounts)

        An account can be related to other accounts for example if accounts have been merged, or if policies have been moved from one account to another. This method finds all related accounts, and returns a set of related accounts and the original accounts.
        This will also call AccountTransferPlugin.additionalCustomerAccountRelationships(Account) to find any other relationships between accounts the customer has determined.
        If sourceAccounts is null IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        Parameters:
        sourceAccounts - the set of accounts to find the related accounts
        Returns:
        a set of related accounts including the original set of accounts
